CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01B02

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Fraunhofer Gesellschaft zur Förderung der angewandten Forschung e.V. über Vergabeportal eVergabe

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Fraunhofer Gesellschaft zur Förderung der angewandten Forschung e.V. über Vergabeportal eVergabe

SHORT_DESCR.P: Fraunhofer IMS requires a new or refurbished fully automated electroplating system. In this system 8” (200 mm) wafers can be processed according to the specifications below. Optional: The system can be easily changed to process wafer size 6”.
The wafers are loaded automatically by a robot handler from cassette to cassette.

The system consists at least of 4 electroplating modules for 4 different electrolytes Cu, Ni, Au and Sn, a Prewet/Spin Rinse module, a module for UBM (under bump metallization) removal and one module for the promotion of Ni-Au adhesion. Modules for TSV copper process (i.e. additional vacuum prewet module) must be available optional for this system.
Optional: a waste disposal system for heavy metal waste for the UBM removal module.
The system includes software which offers the option of an operating mode and a manual mode for engineering.
The system includes an interface for a fully automated plating bath analyse equipment for every electrolyte

The system has to be installed by the manufacturer “through the wall” in the cleanroom at Fraunhofer IMS site and must be conform to CMOS compatible cleanroom conditions (class 10). Fraunhofer IMS prepares the cleanroom for the system installation.
For proven reliability the system must be installed in more than 10 units worldwide and the year of construction (if refurbished) has to be 2010 or later.
The system has to allow a completely safe process run without any risk for the health of the operator.
Because of limited cleanroom space the mainframe should have a footprint smaller than [3000 x 3300] mm.
Electronic racks, the waste disposal system and a separate user console are not included in this limitation.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: — Option 1: 24 months in accordance with VOL (Contracting Procedure for the Award of Service Performance Contracts by the Public Sector — Vergabe- und Vertragsordnung für Leistungen), Part B, Sect. 14. The statutory warranty period starts after the date of acceptance,
— Option 4: Waste Disposal System for UBM waste Could-Optionen (please offer, if availible).
— Option 6: UBM Etch optical End Point Detection,
— Option 9: A network compatibility for data export, recipe sharing, offline programming,

SUITABILITY.P: The documents listed in the following must be presented in full with the tender. Incomplete documents coul lead to exclusion from the procedure.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: (1) Designation of the company revenue for the last three business years
(2) Self-declaration regarding the lack of exclusion criteria pursuant to § 123 and § 124 of the German Act Against Restraints of Competition (GWB)
(3) Excerpt from the Central Trade Register according to § 150a GewO (is requested by the client)

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: (1) Company profile and the actual amount of employees.

(2) References from comparable projects not more than 3 years old (minimum information: Name of the clients and contacts including contact data). If, for reasons of data protection, you are not allowed to name your contact persons, please categorize your client (research, industry, other public clients).

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: In the event that subcontractors are used, they must be named and their suitability is likewise to be substantiated on the basis of the listed documents under III.1). Furthermore, it must be confirmed that they will be available if the order is placed; their share in the scope of the contractual object must be stated.

INFO_ADD.P: Request of documents — available at: The award documents can be retrieved exclusively through the award portal of the German e-Vergabe at www.deutsche-evergabe.de. With the tender submission, contenders are also subject to the provisions regarding unsuccessful tenders (§134 GWB [German Act Against Restraints of Competition]). Questions or remarks from the tenderer must be sent, in English only, exclusively via e-mail to the contact point named under No. I.1. As far as relevant, responses to the questions or remarks of the tenderer shall also be sent to all other tenderers.
Pursuant to Section 9 Par. 3 S. 2 VgV (German public procurement regulation), the contract noticeandtheawarddocuments are available to you at the German eVergabe with or without registration.
Please note that registration is required for requests to participate, tender submissions and tenderer questions.
We therfore recommend early registration, also in order to receive any tenderer information; you otherwise bear the risk of possible tender exclusion.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Precise information on deadline(s) for review procedures:

Precise information on deadline(s) for review procedures: Precise information on the deadlines for filing appeals: As long as a contract has not yet been effectively awarded (conclusion of contract), an application fora review can be made as an appeal with the body named under VI 4.1. Contenders/tenderers must promptly file complaints regarding violations of the provisions governing the award of public contracts with the awarding body named under I.1) before they apply for a review. We expressly point out the application deadline of §160 German Act Against Restraints of Competition [Gesetz gegen Wettbewerbsbeschränkungen — GWB]. Tenderers whose offers are not successful shall be informed before the award of the contract pursuant to §134 GWB.
